DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date on which radiotherapy object was reviewed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Approved; established by authority; given authoritative approval._The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis._a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:Approved; established by authority; given authoritative approval.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 11/5/19 jk unretired; this is the DICOM format for date and used in DICOM CDEs.  4/26/10 Retired per Content Team review of Imaging Set 2 CDEs under caBIG review.  SUPERCEDED with existing VD 2015863.  6/21/07-Released for NCIA CDE curation. ;  5/31/07-Create for CDEs using the DICOM Date format; based on 2007 DICOM Standard, section 3.
